messages.message:
*Sharing some notes from a call with paying customer number 3 (Termina.ai (http://Termina.ai) by Tribe Capital) for visibility.*

Termina are looking to use AI Hub to get info from pitch decks. They’ve already been using Google Doc AI + GPT and want IB to replace it. They want to get summarised results, display them to users, and allow them to ask follow-up questions. They have built an AI Hub app and started to call it using our run apps API.

• Key Features they want (in order of importance inferred by me).
    ◦ Being able to read charts from input documents. cc: @Rakesh @Rafal for model dev
    ◦ Structured data type response from app results. cc: @Bastiane @andy for app runs, and refiners.
    ◦ Ability to see docs I’ve uploaded from API in the UI (file explorer). cc: @Heymian @hannah 
    ◦ Ability to duplicate app/compare versions side by side. cc: @Eric Han @Bastiane for build
    ◦ Dynamically configure apps, so that they can use us as Infra as Code. cc: @Bastiane related to the discussion for Labelbox
• They also asked about few features we already have.
    ◦ Delete files that are uploaded. We support this (docs) (https://instabase.com/docs/23.07/apis/v2-apis/filesystem-v2/index.html#delete-a-file-or-folder)
    ◦ Converse APIs - @Balaram @jean, we should share docs once they are ready
    ◦ Chart generation. cc: @Hari 
@Tom it may be interesting to have your team connect with them about commercial too.
Thanks Avi! Happy to connect if you want to pull me in as it makes sense
I don't have an indication of volume yet. It seems like it will be low. @Varun Jain have you discussed this with Kavin?

◦ Delete files that are uploaded. We support this (docs) (https://instabase.com/docs/23.07/apis/v2-apis/filesystem-v2/index.html#delete-a-file-or-folder)
@avi can you add more details here?
Yup, they basically want a way to delete any file that they upload in case users request them to purge data. We support this using APIs today
Are they planning to use AIHub through APIs?
Yes, they want to use AI Hub as an engine to process documents using APIs. They are already using the run apps API.
@Tom Their expected volumes are quite low (~thousands / year). It will be good to talk to them for an exploratory conversation regardless, as they are interested in many commercial features.

> Being able to read charts from input documents
this sounds like quite a complex request. To fully support it we would need to have multimodal LLMs. OpenAI didn’t yet released mulitmodal GPT4
It would be helpful to get some details around specific queries and documents they are using to work with charts

They are querying pitch decks which often have breakdown charts (often as pie charts), or trend lines. I don't have example documents or prompts for the moment.

Makes sense that this is complex without multi-modal LLMs. Next time we meet, I'll ask if they can share more details. But for now they are unblocked to experiment with just text and tables.
